case_vignette:
A 29-year-old woman, gravida 2, para 1, at 30 weeks' gestation comes to the emergency department because of severe right-sided back pain for the last hour. The pain is colicky and radiates to the right groin. The patient also reports nausea and pain with urination. Pregnancy has been uncomplicated and the patient reports that she has been following up with her gynecologist on a regular basis. There is no personal or family history of serious illness. She does not smoke or drink alcohol. Medications include folic acid and a multivitamin. Temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 90/min, and blood pressure is 130/80 mm Hg. Examination of the back shows costovertebral angle tenderness on the right side. Laboratory studies show:
Urine
Protein negative
RBC casts negative
RBC 5–7/hpf
WBC casts negative
WBC 1–2/hpf
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Renal and Genitourinary System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm having severe pain on the right side of my back that spreads to my right groin and I feel nauseous. I also find it painful when I urinate.
How old are you?
I am 29 years old.
Have you had any history of kidney stones?
No, I haven't had any history of kidney stones.
Do you have any family history of kidney problems or kidney stones?
No, there is no family history of serious illness including kidney problems or stones.
Are you currently taking any medications or supplements?
Yes, I'm taking folic acid and a multivitamin.
**Final Diagnosis:** Possible Kidney Stone

I've been having severe right-sided back pain for the last hour, and it's spreading to my right lower belly area. I also feel sick to my stomach and have pain when I pee.

I recommend seeking immediate medical attention for a thorough evaluation and appropriate management.
